HDG.BC.content: knowing grammar contributes nothing to our understanding [what about Einführung?] > no doubt about “is” in “weather is fine”—how do we make “is” questionable? > fullness/variability of beings never comes from “is” or being, comes from beings themselves (weather, street, bad, closed, dark)

HDG.FS.content: acc. Heidegger, for Hegel, bad infinite = endless character of finite, ad infinitum; true infinite, in-finite, sublation of finite, where finite is abandoned (das Endliche verlassen wird) = power of conjoining itself

HDG.FS.content: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation

HDG.FS.content: how does dialectical movement avoid falling back into domination of finite, in guise of bad infinite? > answer circularity runs into this difficulty w/out resolving it [beyond hermeneutic circle?]

HDG.EC.content: because devastation is deeper, comes from farther away, our thoughts return to it again and again > the devastation of earth, the annihilation (Vernichtung) of human essence: evil itself (das Böse selbst) > evil not as the morally bad, the reprehensible, but as malice (Bösartige)

HDG.EC.content: referring to evil I see better how we can encounter devastation, that we cannot encounter devastation > must think devastation more rigorously > since devastation is not moral badness (Schlechtigkeit), moral indignation (moralische Entrüstung), even if it makes general public (Weltöffentlichkeit) its mouthpiece, can’t do anything against devastation > moral superiority (Überlegenheit) in no position to grasp, much less abolish (aufzuheben)/mitigate evil

HDG.OHF.content: covering up of soil from which which definition of human arose: logon exon, animal rationale [rational becomes the logical], Christian Dasein as person capable of knowing, human cut to the measure of faith (glaubensmässig vorbestimmt) as being-created (Geschaffensein) in image of God

HDG.OHF.content: for faith, man is “fallen,” his being-fallen not derived from God, but state into which man brought himself [explanation of Kant-like co-givenness of man’s goodness & his possibility of falling] > primordial experience of being-sinful (Sündigseins) at particular time: closed context of experience, basis of anthropology of Christian theology > [Nietzsche-like] God-relation (as constitutive) neutralized into consciousness of norms/values, center of acts (archē), “Ego-pole”

HDG.OHF.content: relation of definitions of classificatory order: not one and then the other, but one is defined as that which belongs to the other [hetero-tautology], in itself it is the other as well, all others: (Welche Vorhabe? die des Wegsehens!) > the as-well-as (Sowohl-als auch), fundamental formal/categorial structure, limitlessness of its universality [bad infinity?]
